stream_context.summary: Kaze works on Course 11, now titled “Grandsand Badland,” polishing a Western set-piece: fixing Fast64 texture bugs, adding a ‘3-2-1 FIRE’ quick-draw, coding swinging saloon doors, creating a growing-hat gag for the bartender Koopa, and rewriting the audio engine so Boshi’s voice can be pitch-shifted. Memory limits and RSP load remain major tech concerns.

development_findings.summary: Only a handful of tasks remain on Course 11: anchor floating tracks, chain-chomp allocation change, animate train wheels + smoke + SFX, finish swinging saloon doors, growing bartender hat, star names, distant signs.
development_findings.quote: “It is actually a pretty short list… then after that there’s just one thing left and that is the bartender's hat.”

development_findings.summary: Fast64 ‘render-mode bleeding’ caused bar textures to show wrong colours; Kaze verified it’s an editor bug, not the game.
development_findings.quote: “I think this is a Fast64 bug.”

development_findings.summary: Boshi quick-draw redesigned with a random 1–3 s delay and audible countdown (‘3-2-1-FIRE’) after chat feedback.
development_findings.quote: “You definitely need more time before the fire… I’ll try a 3-2-1.”

development_findings.summary: Swinging saloon doors coded with physics, friction, and kick interaction; bug fixed by using angle-to-Mario instead of face-angle; doors now orient correctly and no longer push Mario into the warp.
development_findings.quote: “It was all because I used face angle instead of angle to Mario.”

development_findings.summary: Out-of-memory on Course 11 restricts adding new NPCs (e.g., Cowboy Hammer Bro).
development_findings.quote: “We’re kind of out of memory, so I don’t really want to add new characters if we can prevent that.”

development_findings.summary: Implemented hat-growing gag: Koopa bartender’s hat Y-offset increases ~10 units per collected star; head mesh was trimmed and script added.
Audio engine refactor: removed duplicate code, added per-sound pitch field in dialogue system, allows Boshi (and future characters) to play at lower pitch without extra RSP cost.
development_findings.quote: “We implemented this free of cost… the Boshi pitch has been lowered.”

development_findings.summary: Sauraen is rewriting F3DEX to be less RSP intensive so RTYI is no longer CPU-bound.
development_findings.quote: “Sauraen’s working on making F3DX less RSP intensive in the hopes that it'll work on RTYI.”

context_findings.summary: Kaze’s critique philosophy: welcomes feedback but remains blunt; blocks users for spam.
context_findings.quote: “Always look at criticism objectively… If you’re going to be annoying, I will block you.”

context_findings.summary: Streaming improves his mood: felt ill pre-stream but fine once coding live.
context_findings.quote: “God, I felt like shit before the stream started but now I'm feeling fine.”

context_findings.summary: Pays a shorts editor ~$270 / yr and considers buying Lilaa a new PC as partial compensation for her level-editing work.
context_findings.quote: “What if I just get you the PC and only a portion of that counts?”

context_findings.summary: Avoids self-insert characters; views them as ‘cringe’.
context_findings.quote: “I don’t put myself in my games… self inserts is a little cringe.”

biobak.summary: Began re-texturing Course 11; container asset now looks ‘weathered’ and has more depth, impressing Kaze.
biobak.quote: “He just started reworking Course 11 and this already looks insane.”

biobak.summary: Will texture the missing level signs.
biobak.quote: “Not all the signs are there … Zeina’s making the textures.”

badub.summary: Kaze plans to request custom Western duel music rather than recycling existing tracks.
badub.quote: “I’m planning to have completely custom music here.”

zeina.summary: Currently producing sign textures for Course 11.

key_stories.title: Countdown Quick-Draw
key_stories.summary: Early testers felt the Boshi duel started too abruptly. Kaze adds a visible ‘3-2-1’ and adjusts the random delay between ‘Ready’ and ‘Fire’.
key_stories.challenge: Players had no reaction window; duel felt unfair.
key_stories.process: Chat feedback → adjust frame timer → randomise delay 1–3 s → add click SFX.
key_stories.outcome: Fail/win flow now readable; Kaze and chat satisfied.

key_stories.title: Swinging Door Nightmare
key_stories.summary: Creating authentic saloon doors required custom physics and angle math; doors kept rotating the wrong way.
key_stories.challenge: Doors swung opposite of Mario’s push and sometimes blocked the warp.
key_stories.process: Debugged angle math, switched from object face-angle to angle-to-Mario, clamped rotation, tweaked friction.
key_stories.outcome: Doors now behave consistently; inside set removed for readability.
key_stories.key_quote: “It was all because I used face angle instead of angle to Mario.”

key_stories.title: Hat That Grows
key_stories.summary: Kaze scripts bartender Koopa’s hat to rise higher each star to create a comedic visual progression.
key_stories.challenge: Need a small, memorable gag tying acts together.
key_stories.process: Scaled head mesh down 40 units, added per-star Y-offset (+10 each), tested in-game.
key_stories.outcome: Hat visibly taller on subsequent visits; easter egg complete.

key_stories.title: Audio Pitch Overhaul
key_stories.summary: Boshi’s voice needed to sound deeper; existing system expensive and duplicated.
key_stories.challenge: Original ‘soundbank pitch’ multiplied every SFX call; code bloat.
key_stories.process: Refactored audio engine: removed duplicate blocks, added per-dialogue pitch flag, cheap runtime cost.
key_stories.outcome: Boshi plays at –32 semitones; system reusable for future characters.
key_stories.key_quote: “We saved three instructions… and Boshi pitch has been lowered.”

open_questions.context: Kaze says the level is out of memory and cannot hold new NPCs.
questions: What concrete memory limits are you hitting?
Have you profiled where the biggest allocations are?
Could asset streaming or bank splitting free space for additional characters?

open_questions.context: Sauraen is rewriting F3DX to lower RSP load so RTYI stops bottlenecking.
questions: What specific changes is he making to the micro-code?
How severe is the current bottleneck (percent of frame time)?
Will the new code require asset or tool changes for the art team?

open_questions.context: Kaze wants ‘proper’ bespoke music instead of SMW or SM64 rips.
questions: Has Badub started composing the track?
What references or mood is the team aiming for?
How will the music adapt to duel states (countdown, fail, victory)?

open_questions.topic: Star names and Yoshi coin objectives
open_questions.context: Kaze notes they still need naming and a few Yoshi coin concepts.
questions: What’s the narrative through-line for Course 11’s star list?
How do Yoshi coins tie into overall progression?
Any plans to reuse community suggestions?

open_questions.context: Someone asked if multiplayer is still realistic; Kaze unsure.
questions: What tech hurdles remain (input, camera, netcode)?
Would multiplayer change level design philosophy?

open_questions.context: Kaze hints at finishing the level by next Saturday; broader timeline unclear.
questions: What internal milestones remain before a public demo/release?
How does the team balance polish vs. scope creep?
Any plans for phased releases or early testing groups?
